text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

nance of a case identified as an Abusive Tax Avoidance Transactions (ATAT) case. (
) There are designated Integrated Collection System (ICS) subcodes and non- case direct time codes that are to be used to capture and report time spent an ATAT case. (
) ATAT cases must be correctly subcoded to accurately capture ATAT time. Per IRM

), ICS and ENTITY Subcodes (Field Collection Areas only), a subcode should be immediately assigned by the revenue officer or group manager before the end of the reporting period in which the case was assigned. Time spent on an assigned ATAT case will be charged to that case. (
) The following subcodes are available on ICS to identify ATAT cases. a. Subcode
– ATAT. Use this code with all Collection ATAT work not defined by codes
through
b. Subcode

– Collection Strategy (Formerly Offshore Voluntary Compliance Initiative (OVCI)). This subcode is reserved for future use and will be defined for a specific ATAT project or compliance initiative as is identified. Do not use this subcode until directed by Headquarters. The update to the title of this subcode will not take place in ICS until FY
c. Subcode
– Offshore Voluntary Disclosure Initiative/Program (OVDI/OVDP). Use this code with all collection work related to OVDI/ OVDP applicants. d. Subcode

– Intermediary Transactions. Use this code for the ment of Large Business & International (LB&I) examination requests for collection assistance or audit assessments for taxpayer entities ing in an Intermediary Transaction Tax Shelter, including any transferee assessments resulting from audit assessments. This tax shelter is in Notice
and
e. Subcode

– Promoter/Preparer (Formerly Promoter). Use this for all promoter/preparer investigations assigned as Bal Dues, Del Rets, Compliance Initiative Program (CIP). The update to the title of this subcode will not take place in ICS until FY
f. Subcode
– Notice

(Son of BOSS). Use this code with all Collection ATAT work related to taxpayers identified under Notice Loss Deductions, Disallowance of: Artificial Losses: Abusive Tax Partnerships: Basis. The type of transaction, or series of transactions, referred to as the “Son of BOSS” transaction is a “listed” transaction outlined in Notice

It generally refers to certain transactions that are marketed to generate tax losses through the taxpayer’s purported creation of artificially high basis in partnership interests. The taxpayer attempts to recognize deductible losses on the disposition of the partner- ship interest or assets coming out of the partnership, even though no economic loss is incurred. Several examination project codes are used to identify “Son of BOSS” examinations. All “Son of BOSS” examinations be identified by tracking code
on the Examination Returns Control System (ERCS). g. Subcode
- Collection Strategy (Formerly Announcement
Global Settlement Initiative). This subcode is reserved for future use will be defined for a specific ATAT project or compliance initiative as it is
Abusive Tax Avoidance Transactions identified. Do not use this subcode until directed by Headquarters. The update to the title of this subcode will not take place in ICS until FY
h. Subcode
- ATAT FPLP Contract Vendor. Use this code on all Federal Payment Levy Program (FPLP) contract vendor cases assigned an ATAT group. An FPLP case is identified by a TC
AC

a match between a delinquent account and a Financial Management Service (FMS) payment. The case will be assigned to an ATAT group when the investigation of the taxpayer reveals one or more of the characteristics:-Threeormore in-business or out-of-business related entities identified. - Any of the responsible parties has outstanding Trust Fund Recovery Penalty assessments from three or more entities. - Case has a foreign component. i. Subcode

- Collection Strategy (Formerly High Dollar Currently Not Collectible (CNC) Project). This subcode is reserved for future use and will be defined for a specific ATAT project or compliance initiative as is identified. Do not use this subcode until directed by Headquarters. The update to the title of this subcode will not take place in ICS until FY
j. Subcode

- Collection Strategy (Formerly Easement Settlement Offer). This subcode is reserved for future use and will be defined for a specific ATAT project or compliance initiative as it is identified. Do not use this subcode until directed by Headquarters. The update to the title of this subcode will not take place in ICS until FY
k. Subcode
— Refund Schemes. Use this code on cases where the taxpayer(s) claimed false withholding credits (W-
and Form
-OID) other refundable credits (for example, Form
, Credit for Federal Tax Paid on Fuels and Form
, Notice to Shareholders of Undistributed Long-Term Capital Gains) which resulted in a fraudulent refund. Subcode

should only be used when a revenue officer is working in the recovery of a refund. If the refund module is closed due to actions such as a CI referral, suit, offer in compromise, or currently not collectible status and no new refund scheme module is received (e.g. MFT
frivolous penalties) then subcode
for general ATAT work should be used. l. Subcode
- LB&I Distressed Asset Trust (DAT). Use this code on LB&I DAT cases identified under Notice
m. Subcode
- IRC §
A Penalty Assessments. Use this code with all IRC §

for individuals and MFT code

number
for all other cases. n. Subcode

- Offshore Banking (Formerly United Bank of Switzer- land (UBS)). Use this code with all collection work resulting from examinations of taxpayers who did not voluntarily disclose their offshore activity. These cases are referred to as treaty cases by revenue agents involved in the examinations. Do not use subcode
for OVDI/OVDP cases. The update to the title of this subcode will not take place in ICS until FY
o. Subcode
- ATAT Estate and Gift. Use this code on all ATAT Estate and Gift cases. p. Subcodes

Collection Strategy. These subcodes have been reserved for future use and will be defined for specific ATAT projects and compliance initiatives as they are identified. Do not use these subcodes until directed by Headquarters. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

5.20 Abusive Tax Avoidance Transactions
Tax Avoidance Transactions Time Reporting 5.20.2 page
A case that has been correctly subcoded as an ATAT case will retain its ATAT subcode throughout the life of the case. a. Fraud Development cases. Per IRM
, Aging of Collection Fraud Cases, ATAT cases will not be updated to ICS subcode
when Fraud Technical Advisor (FTA) assistance is present. In these instances, the ATAT subcode will remain. The group manager or their designee will request upload of TC
AC
through ICS if it was not previously input. To initiate the TC
AC
, the group manager should access the case in ICS, use the drop down menu “Collection Activities” and “Generate TC
AC
” and input the TC
AC
With FTA approval documented on Form

-A, Fraud Development Recommen- dation - Collection, the revenue officer will input “FRD” for fraud in the location block on ICS. Under Entity Detail select “Name/Address.” Select the taxpayer’s address and click on view/edit. Enter “FRD” in the location block and save. The TC
AC

will stop the cycle clock and prevent the taxpayer entity from being included in systemic IDRS/Entity case reports. It is important to enter FRD in the location block. This is the mechanism for including the case in the Area fraud report. If TC
AC

and FRD are not input, the case will not be counted in the Area fraud report. When the case is no longer in fraud development status or FTA involvement is withdrawn, the revenue officer will delete “FRD” from the location block. b. Offer in Compromise (OIC). The correct ICS subcode must be maintained on the case when an OIC is submitted. Per IRM
, Processing Offer in Compromise (OIC) Receipts, when an offer is received on an assigned case by a field revenue officer, Form
, Offer in Compromise Revenue Officer Report, must be completed and attached to the offer package. Form

should include any information known about the nature of the scheme and the taxpayer’s income and assets. If return of the OIC is recommended, then the ATAT subcode will remain on the case. If an offer is submitted and collection will be suspended and the offer will be worked by the OIC Specialist, then the ICS subcode should be to
, OIC. The time spent completing Form
and forwarding the to Centralized Offer In Compromise for processing should not be reported to time code
The subcode on ICS should only be updated to

by an offer group upon receipt of the offer file for investigation after the pro- cessability determination has been made. c. Collection Due Process (CDP). CDP cases will retain their ATAT subcode. Time codes
through

are available on the ICS pick-list to capture case time spent by collection employees on non-assigned ATAT work. For example, these codes should be used when assistance is given to another revenue officer working an ATAT case or a preliminary opinion is provided to Examination and a CIP is not required. Internal Revenue Manual
Abusive Tax Avoidance Transactions (
) A revenue officer is designated on ICS as Position Type “Special Compliance Program” (SCP) when
% or more of their monthly total direct time is charged to the ATAT time codes for two consecutive months. The should be removed for any employee not meeting the

% direct time rule two consecutive months. Managers of employees working ATAT cases monitor time reporting to ensure revenue officers are properly designated as SCP. Requests to update the designation should be made to the ICS Quality Analyst (IQA). The IQA is responsible for inputting and removing the tion on the ICS employee tables. (
) A revenue officer designated as SCP is excluded from targeted inventory measures allowing adjustments to lower inventories. (
) In addition to potential fraud development cases, TC
AC
can be on ATAT and suit development cases to suspend the overage calculation. Suit (
) The following cases qualify for suspension of the overage calculation with group manager approval: (cid:
) All cases with an ICS subcode of

is input by selecting “Generate TC

in the ICS case history. (

AC
” has two sub choices. The first will generate TC
AC
to suspend the overage clock. The second will generate a
AC
which turns the overage clock back on. ICS cannot upload these transactions to IDRS unless there is open IDRS Bal Due or Del Ret module, therefore option “Generate TC
AC
” is blocked unless an open IDRS Bal Due or Del Ret module is present. Prepare a manual Form
if there are no open modules on ICS. (

to the case. The ICS subcode
will automatically trigger input of IDRS TC

Cases, for information on suspending the overage calculation on general program suit development cases. (
) TC
AC
will be automatically generated when the last IDRS module is closed. There is no need to manually request input of TC
AC
at the time of closing a case. If a case will remain open but the overage clock to be started, manually request input of TC

AC
”. To check for an unreversed TC

take the following steps: - From the case summary screen, select ″Entity Detail Menu″ - Select item ″View Entity Transactions″ - A listing of the Entity transactions on the case will appear; scroll through to check for any unreversed TC
